Prerequisites: (A) QMB3003 OR MAC2233 OR (ANY CALCULUS 1 OR HIGHER COURSE), AND (B) ACG3301 OR EQUIVALENT, (C) 60 CREDITS EARNED, AND (D) QUALIFYING BACC ENTRANCE EXAM SCORE A
Course Description: THE STUDY OF THE CONCEPTS AND TERMINOLOGY OF ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS AND THE USE OF IT TO AND DECISION MAKING IN ACCOUNTING AND AUDITING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
AFTER COMPLETING THIS COURSE STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO:
1. IDENTIFY INFORMATION FLOW AND BUSINESS PROCESS NEEDS FOR ACCOUNTING AND AUDITING IN A TYPICAL MERCHANDISING OPERATION.
2. ANALYZE AND EVALUATE THE INFORMATION AND BUSINESS PROCESSES TO PREPARE APPROPRIATE ACCOUNTING BOOKS AND RECORDS, ALONG WITH RELATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
3. DESIGN THESE INFORMATION FLOWS AND BUSINESS PROCESSES, AND REPRESENT THEM WITH DOCUMENTATION TOOLS.
4. CLASSIFY THESE FLOW/PROCESS NEEDS FOR IMPLEMENTATION IN AN ENTERPRISE RESOURCE PLANNING (ERP) SYSTEM.
5. USE ACCESS 2013 TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT WELL-STRUCTURED DATABASES THAT ENABLE BUSINESS PROCESSES.
6. USE EXCEL 2013 TO DEFINE FORMULAS FOR IMPLEMENTING ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES AND INTERNAL CONTROLS IN AN ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEM.
7. ANALYZE INTERNAL CONTROL IN ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS, AND DESIGN DATA ANALYTICS TO MITIGATE THE BUSINESS RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH THE VERY LARGE DATA SETS STORED IN INFORMATION SYSTEMS.

MAJOR TOPICS
1. ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS: AN OVERVIEW
2. OVERVIEW OF TRANSACTION PROCESSING AND ENTERPRISE RESOURCE PLANNING (ERP) SYSTEMS
3. SYSTEMS DOCUMENTATION TECHNIQUES
4. RELATIONAL DATABASES
5. CONTROL AND ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS
6. SYSTEMS DEVELOPMENT AND SYSTEMS ANALYSIS
7. COMPUTER FRAUD
8. REVENUE CYCLE: SALES TO CASH COLLECTIONS
9.  EXPENDITURE CYCLE: PURCHASING TO CASH DISBURSEMENTS
10. GENERAL LEDGER AND REPORTING SYSTEM
11. DATABASE DESIGN USING THE RESOURCE-EVENT-AGENT (REA) DATA MODEL
12. IMPLEMENTING AN REA MODEL IN A RELATIONAL DATABASE
